alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:57PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wallowa County through 530 PM PDT... At 456 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Paradise, or 28 miles south of Lewiston, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paradise. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
